alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 01 at 1:24PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Snow melt and reservoir releases will cause the river flows to remain high. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. An increase in snowmelt is expected this weekend, resulting in higher flows returning next week. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, Minor flooding of lowlands, pasture, farmland and some rural roads in Mason Valley. There may be some minor flooding of yards and basements in Mason. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:05 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain near flood stage this weekend with additional rises possible going into early next week. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/06/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Mason Bridge and Miller Lane are closed. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon.
